weather.weather_impact_note: Cool and overcast conditions in Berlin, but with minimal wind and no rain expected, weather should not significantly affect offensive performance.

injuries.impact_note: Taylor is set for a full workload against a Falcons defense missing key defenders.

angles: Indianapolis' offense is expected to lean on RB Jonathan Taylor heavily, facing a Falcons defense without multiple defensive line starters.

qb.name: Josh Allen
qb.recent_role_note: Multi-TD machine (13 passing TDs through Week 9) and focal point of Bills offense
qb.matchup_note: Faces struggling MIA defense he's historically dominated (3 total TD per game vs MIA)

rb.name: Christian McCaffrey
rb.recent_role_note: Do-it-all bellcow, heavily featured with backup QB (25+ touches likely)
rb.matchup_note: Rams undermanned on D; expect SF to feed CMC to control game

wr.name: Amon-Ra St. Brown
wr.recent_role_note: Target hog (10+ tgt in 5 of L6); on 4-game 100+ yd streak until Wk9 dip
wr.matchup_note: WSH secondary hemorrhaging yards; St. Brown should slice them from slot all day

te.name: Sam LaPorta
te.recent_role_note: Consistent and explosive (6-97-1 last game) rare for a rookie TE
te.matchup_note: WSH notoriously bad vs TE; LaPorta poised for another big game and red-zone looks

notes: The Giants have gone Over the total in 4 of their last 5 games thanks to a leaky defense and surprisingly effective offense.
The Commanders have stayed Under in five straight games, averaging under 30 total points in that span, a byproduct of poor offense and decent defense.

weather_watch.note: Forecast of snow showers and low-40s temps; could hinder passing if accumulation occurs
Steady rain expected in New Jersey; heavy reliance on run likely for both teams
Rain likely in Seattle (60%+ chance), though not too heavy; Seahawks might run a bit more
Cold and overcast in Berlin but minimal wind; playing conditions are fine for offense
